title: Business introduction app for a delivery/errand service

requirements.text: Create a responsive business introduction website-style app for a local delivery/errand service (inspired by Zippy’s Errand Services) with clear sections for: business overview, services offered, how it works, and contact information.
acceptanceCriteria: App has a polished landing page with sections: Overview, Services, How It Works, Contact.
All user-facing text is in English.
Layout is mobile-first and adapts cleanly to desktop widths.

requirements.text: Add a Services section that highlights at least three service categories: Grocery Delivery, Restaurant Delivery, and Special Delivery (pickup/drop-off from local stores), each with a short description and a clear call-to-action.
acceptanceCriteria: Services section displays the three categories with readable descriptions.
Each service card/row includes a visible CTA (e.g., “Request this service”).

requirements.text: Implement a “Request an Errand / Contact” form that collects: name, phone number, optional email, service type (grocery/restaurant/special), pickup details, drop-off details, notes, and preferred time window; validate required fields on the client.
acceptanceCriteria: Form includes all specified fields and prevents submission when required fields are missing.
On successful submission, user sees a confirmation state/message and the form resets.

requirements.text: Create backend support to store submitted contact/request form entries in stable canister storage, including created timestamp, and provide query methods to fetch entries (for an owner/admin view).
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes an update method to create a request entry and persists it across canister upgrades.
Backend exposes a query method to list stored requests (newest-first or oldest-first, but consistent).
Stored entry includes all fields submitted by the form plus a created timestamp.

requirements.text: Add an admin-only page in the frontend to review submitted requests (read-only list + detail view). Protect access using Internet Identity authentication and restrict viewing to a configured admin principal list in the backend.
acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users cannot access the admin page.
Authenticated non-admin users are denied access (with a clear message).
Admin users can view a list of requests and open a request to view full details.

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive, distinct visual theme appropriate for a local errand/delivery business (avoid blue/purple): warm, trustworthy colors (e.g., charcoal + cream + orange accents), friendly typography, consistent spacing, and clear CTAs across the app.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is used consistently across headings, buttons, cards, and spacing.
Primary CTA styling is consistent and stands out from secondary actions.

requirements.text: Add generated static brand assets and wire them into the UI: a simple logo and a hero illustration/banner on the landing page. Store generated images under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend.
acceptanceCriteria: Images exist in frontend/public/assets/generated and are displayed on the landing page.
No backend routing is used for serving these static images.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit files in frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths; compose UI using those components instead.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Real-time chat, SMS, push notifications, or email sending integrations.
Third-party auth providers other than Internet Identity.

required: Minimalist delivery/errand service logo mark with text “Zippy’s Errand Services” (zippys-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Wide hero banner illustration of a friendly local courier delivering groceries/food bags in a neighborhood, warm palette (zippys-hero.dim_1600x600.png)
